snippet: A spokesman for the Seoul government said satellite images of a growing pile of earth outside a tunnel might signal plans for an underground blast.
abstract: South Korean intelligence officials say satellite images indicate that North Korea might be preparing for its third underground nuclear test, even as it presses ahead with assembling a long-range rocket for its planned launching of a satellite.
lead_paragraph: A spokesman for the Seoul government said satellite images of a growing pile of earth outside a tunnel might signal plans for an underground blast.

headline.seo: South Koreans Suspect That North Plans Nuclear Test
headline.main: South Korea Suspects That North May Test Nuclear Device as Well as Rocket
headline.print_headline: South Korea Sees Sign That North May Test Nuclear Device as Well as Rocket
